results.title: Workers' compensation and its effectiveness. "On compo": workers' compensation in Victoria
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Two programs which address the issue of workers’ compensation in Victoria. In the first program Noel Norton chairs a discussion between Ian Spicer, Ken Stone and Mark Esler on the aspects of concern to them. The second program gives an overview of how workers’ compensation works in Victoria, the legislative and administrative processes involved, and its advantages and disadvantages.

results.title: Work out
results.brief_description: The film dramatises how two persons who are concerned with the same values may differ quite fundamentally in their understanding of them. The film considers freedom as related to security and to change, to morality and to obedience. The immediate incident on which the structure of this film rests is simple: a father’s visit to his son at College. However, the emotions which motivate the visit are complex, emotions which have been dormant and which burst into action when the father discovers that his son has been participating in campus demonstrations.

results.title: Word processing: kissing the girls goodbye
results.brief_description: Once upon a time there was a guy called “the boss” - it was a lonely job. He has to get his own coffee, make pone calls, write his own letters and still run his business. So he hire “his girl” or secretary to assist him whilst he ran the business. She was a kind of servant, messenger and scribe. Today there are tens of millions scattered throughout organisations. Studies have found secretaries skills are not being fully utilised but paper processing is exploding. To the rescue comes world processing and re-organising of secretarial duties.

results.title: Wonderful world
results.brief_description: A world tour the easy way. The Swiss Alps, Venice, Florence, Rome, Vienna, Amsterdam , Brussels, the East, Egypt, and Arabia, India, Japan and the Pacific, Africa, Australia, Canada and the USA, South America - songs and dances, the Sphinx, and the Taj Mahal, Notre Dame in Paris , bull fighting in Spain, and St Lawrence sea-way, from London to Penang; The Statue to liberty to Sydney harbour Bridge; and many other famous and exotic places.

results.title: Wonan
results.creator_credit: Jonne Severijin, Burgwal Films and Netherlands Association for Rehabilitation
results.brief_description: One in a thousand people in Holland are handicapped. In rehabilitation centres they learn skills to assist them with day-to-day living but this is a long process. The needs of special home facilities required by the disabled person are discussed with the family so the individual can eventually become independent.
